snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said there was “no reason to panic” about gas shortages caused by Hurricane Sandy, which forced the temporary closing of New York Harbor.
abstract: Gov Andrew M Cuomo says there is no need to panic about gasoline shortages caused by Hurricane Sandy, which forced the temporary closing of New York Harbor; says tankers and other vessels are once again en route to their destinations across the region.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said there was “no reason to panic” about gas shortages caused by Hurricane Sandy, which forced the temporary closing of New York Harbor.

headline.seo: Cuomo Says Gas Tankers Are on the Way to New York
headline.main: Cuomo Waives a Tax to Allow Docking Tankers to Unload Their Fuel More Quickly
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Waives a Tax to Allow Docking Tankers to Unload Their Fuel More Quickly
